description: A collection of circles in an angular formation: the top half of the angle (going from the upper left corner toward the bottom right corner) is conical, with a wider top tapering toward the center while the bottom half of the angle (going from the upper right corner toward the bottom left) is rectangular then a half-circle shape at the bottom. Each circle has a different number in the center denoting how many lines stem from that point. There is a small, pale orange triangle in the center of the formation and a dark gold triangle towards the bottom.

author.name: VertexArchive
author.description: An UNOFFICIAL archive of the New York Times' Vertex puzzle. This account is not affiliated with the NY Times. I just like the triangles.
